page.title: 19DYFFRYN RHONDDA
page.content: This is a village that grew up to house workers in the local drift mines especially the large mine close to the village which produced good quality coal. In order to draw attention to the quality of the coal, the owners christened their village Dyffryn Rhondda, claiming a connection with the coal from the Rhondda Valley which was the best around. The school that serves the village contains about 30 children now, but the building was obviously designed for many more children to work in it, so depopulation has taken place.
